Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Nisin E (natural AMPs; lantibiotic, class 1 bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; UCSS1b)
Sequence Information.Source: Streptococcus equinusstrains, APC4007 and APC4008, isolated from sheep milk: sheep microbiota:milk

Literature.Author: Sugrue I, Hill D, O'Connor PM, Day L, Stanton C, Hill C, Ross RP. 2023
Literature.Title: Nisin E Is a Novel Nisin Variant Produced by Multiple Streptococcus equinus Strains.

Sequence Information.Comments: Discovery: isolated from bacteria from sheep milk.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (87.5%) toNisin PC: 16%: T: 19% G: 13%.  10 differences from nisin A, including 2 deletions: Ser29 and Ile30, and 8 substitutions: Ile4Lys, Gly18Thr, Asn20Pro, Met21Ile, His27Gly, Val32Phe, Ser33Gly, and Lys34Asn.Activity: Nisin E producing strains inhibited species of L. lactis, L.  delbrueckii ssp. bulgaricus, L. delbrueckii ssp. lactis, B. firmis, C. difficile, and C. sporogenes. Warning: Activity of purified peptide has not been tested.
